page.title: 08HOUSING 1.
page.content: The Digmoor Housing Estate, made up of Little Digmoor, Digmoor, Clay Brow, and Holland Moor, forms part of the Skelmersdale New Town Development and was built in the 1960's. The houses are built in rows of terraces but differ from one another in size and design. Some are 3 storeys high and there are bungalows and flats. Most houses are of traditional brick but some are prefabricated in concrete. Each house has its own small back garden which is fenced but front doors open directly onto the walkway. The major criticism concerns the planning, with houses built overlooking one another and with no front garden. The majority of accommodation is rented but some tenants have seized the opportunity to buy their own home - this can be done even if unemployed!
